intro: Polyscias subcapitata, commonly known as the small-leaved glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
